title: Eustache du Caurroy - 23 Fantasies - Savall, Hesp XX [Philidor]
description:
From Wikipedia:

"Du Caurroy was primarily interested in counterpoint, and was widely read in the theoretical work of the time, including that of Gioseffe Zarlino, who provided the best available summation of the contrapuntal practice in the 16th century. His contrapuntal interest is best shown in his sacred music, of which the largest collection is the two volumes of motets, 53 in all, entitled Preces ecclesiasticae, published in Paris in 1609. They are from 3 to 7 voices...

"Du Caurroy also wrote instrumental music, including contrapuntal fantasies for three to six instruments. The collection of 42 such pieces, published posthumously in 1610, is considered to be a strong influence on the next generation of French keyboard players..."


Transfers are made at 768 kBits/s, directly from the disc.

A bio is enclosed. You can search on Philidor for all my classical downloads, or check out this thread:
 
https://pirates-forum.org/Thread-Philidor-s-uploads--63895
